definition: lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc
alone/independent/single/sole/only
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: Hongkong Winling has dominated Hongkong basketball league for many years.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，永倫隊在香港籃球聯賽中一直是一枝獨秀。

sentences.english: Bianliang Imperial College is a special branch in the central engraving institutions of Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 在宋代中央刻書機構中，汴梁國子監可謂是一枝獨秀。

sentences.english: Apple lords over the high-end market.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果目前在高端筆記本電腦市場一枝獨秀。

sentences.english: Four Seasons care outshines all else in Alexandria.
sentences.chinese: 四季保健一枝獨秀一切在亞歷山德里亞。

definition: most outstanding/par excellence
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
bellwether
in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
Four Asian Tigers/East Asian Tigers/Four Little Dragons (East Asian economic powers: Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore and Hong Kong)

out of the ordinary
technological development
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique

new era/new epoch
